questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

Examine the RADIUS server configuration shown in the exhibit.
An administrator has configured a RADIUS server on FortiGate that points to FortiAuthenticator. FortiAuthenticator is acting as an authentication proxy and is configured to relay all authentication requests to a remote Windows AD server using LDAP.
While testing the configuration, the administrator noticed that the diagnose test authserver command worked with PAP; however, authentication requests failed when using MSCHAP2.
Which two solutions can the administrator implement to get MSCHAP2 authentication to work? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A is correct - page 48 study guide, C correct page 47 of study guide

choices.A: On FortiAuthenticator, enable Windows Active Directory Domain Authentication to add FortiAuthenticator to the Windows domain.
choices.C: On FortiAuthenticator, change the back-end authentication server from LDAP to RADIUS.
choices.B: On FortiGate, configure the NAS IP setting on the RADIUS server.
choices.D: On FortiGate, update the Secret setting on the RADIUS server.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.2.16/cookbook/861490/zero-touch-provisioning-with-fortimanager

"A DHCP server includes option 240 and 241 which records FortiManager IP and domain name. FortiGate has an interface with the default DHCP client mode that is connected to the DHCP server in the intranet."

Selected Answer: C
study guide p. 196

C is correct as per study guide 196, which specifically states the following
FG retrieves the FortiManager IP address or FQDN through DHCP options 240 or 241 respectively.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct as per study guide page 196

Selected Answer: D
According to the FortiGate Administration Guide, "FortiGate can learn the FortiManager IP address or FQDN for zero-touch provisioning from a DNS server using A or AAAA records. Option C is false because DHCP options 240 and 241 are not used for zero-touch provisioning.

questions.question_text: Where can FortiGate learn the FortiManager IP address or FQDN for zero-touch provisioning?

choices.D: From a DNS server using A or AAAA records
choices.A: From an LDAP server using a simple bind operation
choices.C: From a DHCP server using options 240 and 241

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B and D, study guide p. 267

apologies, BD correct as its asks about MAC based
A incorrect as this is port based
B correct
D correct
Study guide 267

A is correct - P267 specifically states FS authenticates a single host and opens the port to other devices behind that port.
D is correct, P267 Study guide, specifically states if you want to auth each device behind a port and optionally grant each device with a different access level based on credentials provided, then MAC based is required

comments.content: A is only correct with Port-based security mode. The question states MAC-based security mode.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
page 267 of study guide

choices.B: FortiSwitch authenticates each device connected to the port.
choices.D: FortiSwitch can grant different access levels to each device connected to the port.
choices.A: FortiSwitch authenticates a single device, and opens the port to other devices connected to the port.
choices.C: It cannot be used in conjunction with MAC authentication bypass.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about the MAC-based 802.1X security mode available on FortiSwitch are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
as per study guide p. 217

Selected Answer: A
A correct as per study guide

Selected Answer: A
Based on LAN Edge 7.0 Study Guide page 217 When FortiGate discovers the first switch, it automatically adds to its configuration some settings that are default, quarantine, rspan, voice, video, onboarding, and nac_segment

questions.question_text: Which FortiSwitch VLANs are automatically created on FortiGate when the first FortiSwitch device is discovered?

choices.D: fortilink, quarantine, erspan, voice, video, and onboarding
choices.A: default, quarantine, rspan, voice, video, onboarding, and nac_segment
choices.B: access, quarantine, rspan, voice, video, and onboarding
choices.C: default, quarantine, rspan, voice, video, and nac_segment

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit showing a network topology and SSID settings.
//IMG//

FortiGate is configured to use an external captive portal. However, wireless users are not able to see the captive portal login page.
Which configuration change should the administrator make to fix the problem?

choices.C: Enable the captive-portal-exempt option in the firewall policy with the ID 12.
choices.A: Enable NAT in the firewall policy with the ID 13.
choices.D: Remove the guest.portal user group in the firewall policy with the ID 12.
choices.B: Add the FortiAuthenticator and WindowsAD address objects as exempt destinations/services.

discussion.content: B correct page 363 of study guide
